alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Carroll; Henry; Jo Daviess; Mercer; Putnam; Rock Island; Stephenson; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 2:26AM CST until January 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing and significant drifting snow leading to visibility reductions. Winds gusting as high as 35 to 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero this morning and 30 to 35 below tonight through Tuesday morning. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northwest Illinois and east central, northeast and southeast Iowa. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous road conditions this morning due to reduced visibility and snow covered roads from blowing snow. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bureau; Carroll; Henry; Jo Daviess; Mercer; Putnam; Rock Island; Stephenson; Whiteside
